intro: Scabiosa graminifolia subsp. glabra, commonly known as the smooth scabious, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, grass-like leaves that are smooth and glabrous. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and grassy habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to ecological gardens and wildflower displays.
